page.title: 01 VERNHAM DEAN
page.content: { Vernham Dean is a linear village based on a road running down a valley. It consists of several old houses made of flint and brick with thatched roofs. There are also two modern estates of brickbuilt houses, Shepherds Rise and The Dell. Two {smaller groups of modern housing are School Close and Botesdon Close. There is also a group of old peoples bungalows. In the village there is a school, a public house called The George, a village hall, a post office combined with a general shop and a chapel. There is an automatic telephone exchange. The Vicarage is now a privately owned house and there is a Jacobean Manor House. For recreation there is a public playing field. The village is surrounded by fields.
